predicate.note: Frames file for 'upset' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: That meant no trading would occur in the final seconds, as a way of making sure that last-second orders aren't subjected to a sudden price swing that *trace* would upset customers.

example.name: object as subject
example.text: ``I was upset with Roger, I fumpered and schmumpered,'' says Mr. Peters.
example.note: And what the hell does "fumpered and schumpered" mean?

example.name: passivized
example.text: John was sorely upset *trace* by Mary's offer of freshly-baked apple pie.
example.arg: Mary's offer of freshly-baked apple pie

roleset.name: turn over

example.name: toys all over
example.text: John upset Mary's bowl of ornamental fruit.

roleset.note: This is very marginal usage by now, but there is a game called "Upset the Apple Cart".
